Follow these fit women we're crushing on for inspiration, workout ideas, and motivation. You can't [perform at your peak](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/time-saver-circuit-endurance-and-strength/) if your body is not properly fueled. And the best way to make sure you're getting [the nutrients you need ](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/11-most-important-nutrients-fit-women/)is to step back and look at your [overall diet](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/8-weeks-six-pack-abs/) habits. Use this week of meals to detox your diet and eliminate the stuff you don't want, like added sugars and processed carbs. Then, load up on what you do need — [whole foods](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/15-best-lean-muscle-building-foods/) from all the major food groups. The result: a balanced diet that will help you fuel up and fully recover. Consider this a chance to [reboot](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/workout-plan/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/reboot-your-body-2-weeks/) your eating habits to keep your body both satisfied and energized. We've put together four days of menus that you can mix and match over the week. The meals are [simple to prepare ](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/how-make-food-prep-easier/)and have few ingredients, so they'll fit into any crazy-busy schedule. Each meal should include a high-quality lean protein and healthy fat sources to keep hunger levels under control while fueling muscles. As a general rule, aim to get at least five to six servings of [fruits and veggies ](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/5-fruits-and-veggies-you-should-always-buy-organic/)a day, as well as foods that help detox and ensure proper digestion with probiotics and prebiotics. To make it easy, we've included a few [ recipes](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/) that will fit right into your meal prep. Make sure you're staying hydrated by drinking at least 8 ounces of water at each meal and snack, and time your meals for optimal performance. Aim to [ work out](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/) 2 to 3 hours after eating and have a meal or snack within 30 to 60 minutes of exercise to maximize muscle-building activity. Follow each day's meals as listed below or switch them around to suit your taste.
